paper_title.en: Polymer coating for filamentary YBa2Cu3Ox superconductors

description.en: Polymer coating for filamentary YBa2Cu3Ox superconductors was examined. The precursor filaments were prepared by solution spinning through aqueous poly(vinyl alcohol) solution containing mixed acetates of Y, Ba and Cu. The as-drawn filaments were heated to remove volatile components and to generate a superconducting phase. The synthesis of polyamide acid for the polymer coating was made. The filamentary superconductors were coated with the polyamide acid and cured to convert to the polyimide. The surface of the sample was an insulator. The critical current (I-c) value of the filamentary sample at 77 K was preserved by the polyimide coating. Moreover, the I-c for the polyimide-coated sample was maintained after holding at room temperature for more than 6 months. After thermal cycling between 77 K and room temperature 10 times, the I-c for the coated sample did not deteriorate, whereas the I-c for the sample without polymer coating disappeared. Polymer coating using epoxy resin applied to the filamentary superconductors was also examined. (C) 2001 Kluwer Academic Publishers.

paper_title.en: Polymer coating for filamentary YBa2Cu3Ox superconductors

description.en: Polymer coating for filamentary YBa2Cu3Ox superconductors was examined. The precursor filaments were prepared by solution spinning through aqueous poly(vinyl alcohol) solution containing mixed acetates of Y, Ba and Cu. The as-drawn filaments were heated to remove volatile components and to generate a superconducting phase. The synthesis of polyamide acid for the polymer coating was made. The filamentary superconductors were coated with the polyamide acid and cured to convert to the polyimide. The surface of the sample was an insulator. The critical current (I-c) value of the filamentary sample at 77 K was preserved by the polyimide coating. Moreover, the I-c for the polyimide-coated sample was maintained after holding at room temperature for more than 6 months. After thermal cycling between 77 K and room temperature 10 times, the I-c for the coated sample did not deteriorate, whereas the I-c for the sample without polymer coating disappeared. Polymer coating using epoxy resin applied to the filamentary superconductors was also examined. (C) 2001 Kluwer Academic Publishers.

paper_title.en: Critical current density in melt-processed filamentary (Nd, Gd)-123 superconductors

description.en: The preparation of filamentary (Nd, Gd)-123 superconductors was examined by changing starting composition and heating condition of melt processing in flowing 1% O-2 + Ar. High J(c) value of more than 2.4 x 10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and zero field and the high reproducibility were obtained for the filamentary (Nd0.5Gd0.5)-123 sample. The field dependence of J(c) for the sample was measured and J(c) value of more than I x 10(2) A/cm(2) at 77 K and 8 T was detected to the sample. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Oxygen controlled melt growth process of filamentary Gd123 superconductors

description.en: The precursor filament of Gd123 superconductors was prepared by solution spinning through a homogeneous aqueous solution of the metallic acetates, The precursor sample was partially melted in flowing 1% O-2 + Ar under various heating conditions. The maximum J(c) value of 2.1 x 10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and zero field was attained for filamentary Gd1.18Ba2.12Cu3.09Oy superconductors. The sample had well aligned texture, The field dependence of J(c), for the sample was investigated. An angle dependence of Jc along the filament diameter was detected. The J(c). value above I x 10(3) A/cm(2) was obtained at 77 K and 10 T. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Oxygen controlled melt growth process of filamentary Gd123 superconductors

description.en: The precursor filament of Gd123 superconductors was prepared by solution spinning through a homogeneous aqueous solution of the metallic acetates, The precursor sample was partially melted in flowing 1% O-2 + Ar under various heating conditions. The maximum J(c) value of 2.1 x 10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and zero field was attained for filamentary Gd1.18Ba2.12Cu3.09Oy superconductors. The sample had well aligned texture, The field dependence of J(c), for the sample was investigated. An angle dependence of Jc along the filament diameter was detected. The J(c). value above I x 10(3) A/cm(2) was obtained at 77 K and 10 T. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Angular dependence of J(c) for filamentary (Nd,Eu,Gd)123 superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method and oxygen controlled melt growth process

description.en: The filamentary (Nd0.333EU0.333Gd0.333)(1.18)Ba2.12CU3.09Ox superconductors were prepared by solution spinning method and partially melted in flowing 1% O-2 + Ar and then oxygenated by a two-step process. The filamentary sample had a dense and well-aligned texture along the diameter as well as the length. The J(c) of the sample was measured at 77 K in fields up to 10 T. Anisotropic behavior of the J(c)-B curve along the filament diameter was detected. High J(c) value of more than 3500 A/cm(2) at 77 K and 10 T was achieved by applying the field in a direction normal to the c-axis of the sample. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Field dependence of J(c) for filamentary RE-Ba-Cu-O superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method

description.en: The filamentary RE-Ba-Cu-O (RE = Nd, Nd-Eu-Gd, and Nd-Sm-Eu-Gd) precursor was prepared by a solution spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of RE, Ba md Cu, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids, The filamentary precursor was partially melted in flowing 0.1% O-2+Ar or 1%O-2+Ar and then oxygenated under various conditions, The transport critical current density (J(c)) of the samples was measured in magnetic fields up to 10 T at 77 K, The influence of field dependence of Je on the initial different RE elements in the filamentary RE-Bn-Cu-O superconductors was examined, The field dependence of J(c) was improved by mixing three or four different RE elements. The J(c) value at 77 K and up to 6 T for the sample partially melted in flowing 0.1%O-2+Ar was higher than that for the sample melted in flowing 1%O-2+Ar. The highest Je value of more than 1.76 10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and 9 T was detected for filamentary Nd-Sm-Eu-Gd-Ba-Cu-O superconductors partially melted in flowing 0.1 O-2+Ar.

paper_title.en: Field dependence of Jc for filamentary RE-Ba-Cu-O superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method

description.en: The filamentary RE-Ba-Cu-O (RE = Nd, Nd-Eu-Gd, and Nd-Sm-Eu-Gd) precursor was prepared by a solution spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of RE, Ba and Cu, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids. The filamentary precursor was partially melted in flowing 0.1%O2+Ar or 1%O2+Ar and then oxygenated under various conditions. The transport critical current density (Jc) of the samples was measured in magnetic fields up to 10 T at 77 K. The influence of field dependence of Jc on the initial different RE elements in the filamentary RE-Ba-Cu-O superconductors was examined. The field dependence of Jc was improved by mixing three or four different RE elements. The Jc value at 77 K and up to 6 T for the sample partially melted in flowing 0.1%02+Ar was higher than that for the sample melted in flowing 1%O2+Ar. The highest Jc value of more than 1.76 ×104 A/cm2 at 77 K and 9 T was detected for filamentary Nd-Sm-Eu-Gd-Ba-Cu-O superconductors partially melted in flowing 0.1%O2+Ar.

paper_title.en: Angular dependence of Jc for filamentary (Nd,Eu,Gd)123 superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method and oxygen controlled melt growth process
Critical current density in melt-processed filamentary (Nd, Gd)-123 superconductors

description.en: The preparation of filamentary (Nd, Gd)-123 superconductors was examined by changing starting composition and heating condition of melt processing in flowing 1% O2 + Ar. High Jc value of more than 2.4 × 104 A/cm2 at 77 K and zero field and the high reproducibility were obtained for the filamentary (Nd0.5Gd0.5)-123 sample. The field dependence of Jc for the sample was measured and Jc value of more than 1 × 102 A/cm2 at 77 K and 8 T was detected to the sample. © 2001 Elsevier Science B.V.

publication_name.en: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications

paper_title.en: Field dependence of J(c) for melt textured filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)-Ba-Cu-O superconductors

description.en: We have synthesized the filamentary LRE (LRE=Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)123 superconductors by solution spinning and melt growth process in flowing 1%O-2+Ar (OCMG). The effect of heating condition for oxygenation on the field dependence of Je at 77K of the filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)123 superconductors was examined. High Je value of 6100 A/cm(2) at 77 K and 9 T was measured by controlling the heating condition. The T-c of the sample was 95 K with DeltaT(c)=1.5 K. The pinning properties of the sample were examined by extended analysis of volume pinning force and it was found that Delta kappa -point pinning was dominant in this case.

paper_title.en: J(c) for melt-textured filamentary (Nd, Eu, Gd)-123 superconductors

description.en: The filamentary precursor (Nd-0.33,Eu-0.33, Gd-0.33)(1.18)Ba2.12Cu3.09Ox was prepared by a solution spinning method, and partially melted in flowing 0.1%O-2+Ar, and then oxygenated by two-step process. A high Je value of 2.5x10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and 0 T was obtained by controlling the heating conditions. The J(c) value of the sample oxygenated under various conditions was measured at 77 K in fields up to 9 T. The held dependence of Je was strongly dependent on the oxygenating conditions, and a high Je value of about 1.0x10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and 5 T was maintained.

paper_title.en: The effect of initial composition on the oxygen controlled melt growth of filamentary Nd123 superconductor

description.en: We have studied a fabrication of filamentary Nd123 superconductor with high superconducting properties. The filamentary Nd123 precursor was prepared by the solution-spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of Nd, Ba and Cu with various compositions, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids. The filamentary superconductor was produced by the oxygen controlled melt growth (OCMG) method. The effect of initial composition on the OCMG process of the sample was studied to enhance a reproducibility of high transport J(c) of the sample. The compositional region for preparing the sample with high J(c) was narrow. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: The effect of initial composition on the oxygen controlled melt growth of filamentary Nd123 superconductor

description.en: We have studied a fabrication of filamentary Nd123 superconductor with high superconducting properties. The filamentary Nd123 precursor was prepared by the solution-spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of Nd, Ba and Cu with various compositions, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids. The filamentary superconductor was produced by the oxygen controlled melt growth (OCMG) method. The effect of initial composition on the OCMG process of the sample was studied to enhance a reproducibility of high transport J(c) of the sample. The compositional region for preparing the sample with high J(c) was narrow. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Critical current density in filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)-Ba-Cu-O superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method

description.en: The filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)-Ba-Cu-O (LRE123) precursor was prepared by the solution spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd, Ba, and Cu, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids. The filamentary sample was partially melted at 980 degrees C in flowing 0.1% O-2 + Ar and oxygenated under various conditions. The transport critical current density (J(c)) for the samples was examined in magnetic fields up to 10 T at 77 K. The highest J(c) value of more than 1 X 10(4) A/cm(2) at 77 K and 9 T was achieved for the filamentary Nd0.295Sm0.295Gd0.295Ba2.12Cu3.09Ox superconductors by controlling the oxygenation conditions. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Critical current density in filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)-Ba-Cu-O superconductors prepared by a solution spinning method

description.en: The filamentary (Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd)-Ba-Cu-O (LRE123) precursor was prepared by the solution spinning method, through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd, Ba, and Cu, poly(vinyl alcohol) and organic acids. The filamentary sample was partially melted at 980 °C in flowing 0.1% O2+Ar and oxygenated under various conditions. The transport critical current density (Jc) for the samples was examined in magnetic fields up to 10 T at 77 K. The highest Jc value of more than 1×104 A/cm2 at 77 K and 9 T was achieved for the filamentary Nd0.295Sm0.295Eu0.295Gd0.295Ba2.12Cu3.09Ox superconductors by controlling the oxygenation conditions.

publication_name.en: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications

paper_title.ja: Preparation of filamentary (Nd,Sm,Eu,Gd)123 superconductors by OCMG method

paper_title.en: Field dependence of J(c) for re-doped filamentary Hg1212 and Hg1223 superconductors

description.en: Field dependence of transport J(c) for Re-doped filamentary HgRe1212 superconductors was examined in comparison with the filamentary HgRe1223 superconductors. A filamentary Ba2CaCu2Re0.2Ox precursor was fabricated using a solution spinning method and reacted in an evacuated quartz tube with a pellet of (CaHgO2)Ba2Cu2Re0.2,O-x as a reactor. The reacted sample was a nearly single phase of Hg1212 with zero resistivity temperature (T-c) value of 100 K and the highest J(c) value of 7000 A/cm(2) at 77 K and 0 T. The T-c and J(c) decreased slightly by post-annealing in flowing Ar, while the superconductivity at more than 77 K disappeared by post-annealing in flowing O-2. The J(c) values for the as-reacted sample and the sample post-annealed in flowing Ar decreased rapidly by applying the field less than 0.5 T and the superconductivity was not observed by applying the field more than 4 T at 77 K. On the other hand, the superconductivity for the both F and Cl doped filamentary HgRe1223 was maintained at 77 K in a field of 10 T by post-annealing in flowing Ar.

The precursor Y1Ba2Cu3Ox (Y123) filaments were prepared by solution spinning through aqueous poly(vinyl alcohol) solution containing mixed Y, Ba and Cu acetates. The as-drawn filaments were heated to remove volatile components and to generate a superconducting phase. The filamentary superconductors were passed through Ag paste and sintered. By controlling the heating condition, the composite with excellent connection between the filaments and metallic Ag matrix was obtained. The overall transport critical current density (J(e)) of more than 2000 A/cm(2) at 77 K and 0 T was achieved for the composite with partially melted Y123 filaments. Although the J(e) value decreased by applying a low magnetic field less than 0.1 T, the superconductivity of the composite maintained at 10 T at 77 K. (C) 2000 Kluwer Academic Publishers.
